thread.title: PERRIS: Investigation continues into fatal shooting by security guard
thread.title_full: PERRIS: Investigation continues into fatal shooting by security guard - Press Enterprise

author: ALEX GROVES
title: PERRIS: Investigation continues into fatal shooting by security guard
text:
BY ALEX GROVES / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 4, 2015 Updated: Oct. 5, 2015 7:28 p.m. Two days after a man was fatally shot by a security guard at a Perris apartment complex, the shooting remained under investigation and residents were still trying to understand how and why it happened.
Riverside County sheriff’s Deputy Armando Munoz said Monday, Oct. 5, that he could release no additional details, including whether anyone had been arrested, in Saturday’s fatal shooting of Isaac Jermaine Kelly , 33.
Many residents of the Meadowview II apartment complex said both Kelly and the security guard were well-liked and easy-going people.
“(Kelly) didn’t get an attitude, he didn’t have a temper, he wasn’t an angry person,” resident Jessie Key said. “He was just a friendly, ordinary tenant.”
Albert Gallo, who lives across from Key, described Kelly as a quiet, hard-working man. Gallo said Kelly would frequently offer to help carry in his wife’s groceries.
But Gallo said the guard was equally amiable.
“We’ve never had a problem with him,” Gallo said. “We would have festivities and other security guards would shut it down, but this guy was always nice.”
Kelly was fatally shot just after midnight Saturday by a security guard hired by the apartment complex at 150 E. Nuevo Road. Residents said Kelly was walking to get his mail. Sheriff’s officials have not released any details about what led up to the shooting.
Kelly was taken to the hospital, where he was pronounced dead. The sheriff’s homicide unit is investigating the shooting.
An employee who answered the phone at the apartment complex’s on-site management office Monday morning said a manager would be present later in the day. Subsequent calls seeking comment were not returned, and a sign was posted saying the office was closed until Tuesday.
The apartment complex is owned by Irvine-based Reiner Communities, a company that offers affordable housing in California. Multiple phone messages left Monday were not returned.
Contact the writer: agroves@pe.com or @AlexDGroves on Twitter.
